I've always loved RCHP, since I was young enough to be slightly scared of the "Give it Away" music video. They were one of the three bands I acquired a tape for at six years old, and I played those tapes over and over and over (BloodSugarSexMagik, 40 Oz to Freedom, and Onyx) I just realized during this song - John Frusciante is definitely my favorite guitar player. This album Unlimited Love came along at just the perfect moment in time. I even got to see them live in Hershey in 2023 playing some of these songs. The performance on the rooftop in LA, the video for these are the ways. Just gave me something to hold onto at a time we were all struggling with the pandemic. Been a fan since probably 1990. I distinctly remember when Soul to Squeeze was new in 93, I heard it on the in air radio station on a flight to Australia. That song was so special. I hope the chili peppers keep making music as long as their hearts are in it

these guys are aging like the finest wine, I love you thank you
The Chili Peppers have gotten me through middle school, high school, the pain of losing loved ones, addiction, recovery, and countless nights both good and bad. Their music and stories have, at times, been the only thing that kept me going. Theyâ€™re music has been the soundtrack to some of my best and worst moments. Kiedisâ€™ words of pain and anguish gave me hope as I laid in bed sicker than Iâ€™d ever been trying (and succeeding, thank God) to kick addiction and his words have imprinted in some of my fondest memories as their music played in the background of summer nights and great times spent with the people I love and care about most in this world, especially those who are no longer on this planet.  I fell in love with them as a kid when I my buddyâ€™s older brother played the Californication CD, devoured their past work, and immediately bought every album they released (including skipping school after lunch in 2006 to race to the Tower Records off of PCH to make sure I grabbed Stadium Arcadium). Itâ€™s amazing how this band means so much to so many different people and yet the music manages to touch us in a unique way. I love all sorts of music and have many â€œfavoriteâ€ bands and artists but none will ever resonate so deeply in my soul like the Red Hot Chili Peppers. God bless them.  I donâ€™t expect anyone to read this but it felt nice to type all of this out anonymously in a comment section. Maybe itâ€™s because I rarely talk about my past struggles or maybe itâ€™s because I donâ€™t know how to fully articulate this bandâ€™s impact without sounding crazy or maybe itâ€™s because a comment section is cheaper than therapy. All I know is that this music has lifted me up and kept me going from the days of CD players on the bus to middle school to today and for that Iâ€™m eternally grateful.

This is an awesome psychedellic Doors-like song wasted by bad production. I could imagine it as a song by The Doors, which shows a great of a song it is, but it needs much more atmospheric vocals, guitars and/or keys and much less busy drumming and strumming, stick to a simple beat and get shamanic with some layered instruments and backing vox... the Flea bassline alone will give it that RHCP signature, no need to get cute and showy

:)
This highly commercial, lightweight pop-rock sounds absolutely nothing at all like the RHCP of the first three, probably four albums. Nothing wrong with it per se, and nothing wrong with a band changing and evolving, but this is a million miles away from their "psychedelic sex funk" of the 80s. Some might prefer it, but I.prefer the energy, inventiveness and bravado of their earlier work to this by-the-numbers chart-fodder.

The music is so killer but my sipping is the problem
Ok, so near the end I was getting this really positive vibe off of this. And IDK but I feel like he was really building to a crescendo as he repeated WAITING over and over again, and it kinda peaked well, but also not at all at what it's full peak feels like it should be. Like he added feeling, but a little more would've gone a long way here and really given this peak a truly memorable edge and yet as it went it just seems like, while again it was ok, it could've easily been so much better.   Like when Phil Collin's did In The Air Tonight, the kind of peak he built up too AND fully achieved. Somehow Black Summer feels like it was building to a similar peak but just kinda came up a bit short of expectations and so meh is the result, uh, the result of the potential peak. The song as a whole is solid enough still. Just missed opportunity to be oh so much better with minimal effort.   Ok, to anyone really analyzing my comment I am comparing this against an existing & massively popular song to form my opinion, but a lot of the ways both songs built up their stories and led into the chorus and peak is similar, and also this is new. So yeah, I'm definitely going to compare it with existing & similar song styles and see how it fares in comparison.   That said, I guess not comparing it with anything else it's actually a very good (not amazing, but like 4 out of 5 stars still) song strictly all on it's own. However myself personally having such a wide breadth & diversified taste & repertoire in music throughout rock history I'm inevitably going to find something to compare it to. And when it does strike a note of something somewhat similar it falls short of my already existing expectations. It's also a different style for the RHCP too. Seriously, RHCP compared to Phil Collin's? Yeah, other than those 2 songs their way different (if only easy rock vs alternative rock). So I don't know what to make of that aspect of it. It's just how I see it.

UL is good, but really not great. The thing with RHCP till Stadium Arcadium was that the last 1-2 minutes of their songs they were at their best, even a level higher then earlier in the already great songs. That is what this album misses for me, the euphory that they had in the past to end their songs in a classy, powerful way, when they kick it up a notch or 2 extra. Now it is just nothing mesmerizing they end their songs with, wich is sad, the most songs on UL feel like they die out towards the end.

Red Hot Ã© show.
It was in the 90's when my high school buddy introduced me to RHCP, and I immediately loved it. Then it was 1999. Californiacation was out. I went to university in Shanghai. Got hooked up with some other dudes and we started a rock band. We played RHCP a lot. The gear was shitty and so were we. But nevermind, we had a lot of fun. Then we graduated. Started working. Put all that rock band shit behind us. I broke up with my girlfriend. Met someone again.  Changed job. Got married. Had several kids. Lost my job. And then Covid came. Now I'm in quarantine at home for 48 days. All my bandmates are busy with their own lives and we rarely got in contact nowadays. I don't know how they feel, but to me, playing RHCP with them in a shabby rehearsal room back then was the best part of that time. It's 2022, these four are back together. The show goes on. And I'm thinking, perhaps the world ain't that bad after all. Thank you, guys!

Mto obrigado por fazerem minha prÃ© adolescÃªncia  ,adolescÃªncia  e faze adulta feliz ...Obrigado RED HOT CHILI PEPPERS.
Sooo...it's 1:13 in the a.m. & I'm just leaving my Wawa. I'm grown now, so the Radio Tunes of Today & I DO NOT VIBE like we once did in my past life. Since I'm damn near at home, I let the thing play because my mind IS 25.5 MILES AWAY FROM WHERE I BE right now! Within 60 seconds, a few words in, the catchy melody & that voice...INSTANTLY SET OFF MY RED HOT CHILI PEPPERS RADAR! I know my boys & their unique sound. I'M SMILING! I know I'm late, but BETTER LATE THAN NEVER, RIGHT?! WOW! I must say that I'm grateful that my parents introduced me to real music instead of a damn television. My parents never discriminated when it came to the person/s who introduced us to a new, amazing & profound sound & for that reason I'm able to appreciate the greatness that is MY RED HOT CHILI PEPPERS AFTER all these years (1991-present) Damn, I feel sorry for these kids today who are clueless to the sound of a real band.

Mr flea em aÃ§Ã£o
I managed to get myself a advanced copy of the new album and listened to all the new songs. Most of them are quite excellent. And the album itself is truly a work of art. One disappointment though that I have to share with my fellow fans. You're not going to hear those beautiful choruses with Anthony and John like we heard on By the Way and californication.  In my humble opinion, this album focuses primarily on Anthony kiedis's vocals and lyrics. Anthony's vocals are excellent and spot on. We also hear a lot of Base chords with flea and also some trumpets solos as well. Don't expect to hear a lot from John's guitar because he seems to have taken a subdued style of playing on this album allowing flea and Anthony to shine. Here are the songs in order: Black Sunday Here ever after Aquatic mouth dance Not the one Poster child The great apes It's only natural She's a lover These are the ways What you thinking Bastards of light White braids and pillow chair One-way traffic Veronica Let him cry The heavy wing Tangelo

This is the first time I've ever heard this song and immediately I can tell it's John playing on the recording compared to if it was Josh playing on the recording of an original song. People hate on the Dave Navarro era of the peppers but imo that was their best run without John.. one hot minute is an underrated peppers album and they had a few hit singles from that period like aeroplane, and my friends. I have no ill will towards him but when it comes to the Josh Klinghoffer era I cant name one hit single from his era and I never got into the music they did with him no matter how hard I tried. I feel like Josh was a knock off John Frusciante lol. Atleast Dave had his own style. You can't deny the magic and chemistry these 4 dudes have together. I just recently inherited my late great-grandfather's Montgomery Ward Airline Alarm clock radio that has not been powered on since 1988, when he passed away and 9 years before I was born... I powered it on to initial silence, but after fiddling with the clock knob on the back, this was the first song to play on the radio in over 34 years. The clock was dated to have been manufactured anywhere between 1965 to 1970. Talk about the right song to bring new life into an unrestored 50-year-old radio!

Hello from Ukraine. When I was 5-6 years old. I lived with Grandma. And when I   came first to my  mother ( when  i was 7 yeas old )  I saw a poster where four naked men cover their dicks . I asked my mother, who is this? she said - these are hot peppers. After that, I had my own amazing life connected with music. I have a lot of respect for Peppers. Peace for everyone ! I hope the world sees the truth! P.S. Air raid sirens are blaring in my city right now, rock 'n' roll is dead and I'm not. But when peace comes, Ukraine will   show  that we can play music of our hearts  !

How to Play the Game of Life Why do children wake up with their eyes wide open and jump out of bed while we open them just wide enough to see the phone so we can set it to snooze? Why are young people energetic and ready to â€œconquer the worldâ€ while older people are cautious and hesitant? Can we stay young-spirited forever? After all, if life is not a game, there is no excitement in it. And if there is no excitement in life, what is the point of living? If we want to keep enjoying, we need to make life a lifelong game. This game is very different from anything we know. It is not about what we can receive, but about what we can discover! By connecting to other people, we discover new worlds, other peopleâ€™s worlds! How do we achieve this? Quite simply, we need to focus on others rather than on ourselves. This may sound simple, but if you try it, you will realize how self-absorbed you are. We are all like that. Even those who feel that they are generous and giving are absorbed in their giving and do not see how much they do it for their own interest, and how they are focused on their own benefit when they give. Giving is fine, but the focus is the point here. Had the focus been on the receiver, the giver would have discovered countless revelations that are hidden from a self-centered eye. For the game to succeed, you need partners. It is impossible to play the game of giving without people to whom you can give and from whom you can receive. Therefore, there must be a group of people, up to ten or so, who play the game together. In order to succeed in discovering the other playersâ€™ worlds, we need to think good thoughts about them. Otherwise, we will have no incentive to approach them, no desire to discover their world. We can think good thoughts about each other if we do good things for one another. These can be the simplest things, but they must make us feel good about each other. Positive thoughts about each other bring us closer, and closeness opens our minds and hearts to others, so we can see the world through their eyes. As with any game, the more we practice, the better we get, and the harder, yet more rewarding the game becomes. But unlike any other game, as we improve in it, we will find that our entire perspective on life changes and expands, and we become wiser and more competent. The game of life, unlike any other game, reveals to us the secrets of life, the secrets of reality, because when you can look at something from all angles, nothing remains hidden from you.

Thank you for being so special to us both and being the thing that we will always share, no matter what. Legendary band. Frusciante is just fucking unbelievable, playing rock solos in 2022 like it's nothing. I hear a bit of Cantrell in the first one and a bit of Cobain later on. Frusciante's guitar tone is somehow always fresh, while still letting that "clean" strat sound from another era shine through. It's just always full of soul, borrowing that rythmic freedom from Hendrix and never overplaying. Frusciante's guitar parts will be celebrated forever, the ones in this song are no exception.

Il never forget introducing the Red Hot Chili Peppers to everyone I met. To friends or acquaintances at school, cousins, and siblings. In middle school one day at a long lunch table, guys and girls scattered, some one brought up best bands and each was saying their own. When it was my turn, I mentioned the Red Hots being my favorite band of all time when everyone was into scene emo punk rock at the time (2006). They all looked at me like I was completely nuts, then laughed at me. They all said "who's that ??" And I felt embarrassed at the time. Needless to say, each one of those is now a diehard RHCP fan. 2 of my exes then became huge fans too . Lol Never forget when Irvin Showed you the Chili Peppers. ğŸ˜‰

I love the part 0:44 - 0:55, that uni-vibey sound and those double stop licks are definitely a wink to Hendrix
Does Keidis think he's Irish now? What's with the accent? These guys have bugged me with everything they've done since Californication. Everything sounds like a watered-down regurgitation of something else they've done, yet they're still likely technically the best band in the world. Flea, and Chad are the best in the world at their instruments, and Fruciante is way the hell up there. This song sounds like virtually any of their songs on "Stadium Arcaneum" which sounded a lot like the sissy parts of Californication songs, which sounded like SPAM hybrids of everything else they've done, but honestly was still pretty damn good. I liked "Dark Necessities" quite a bit until I got the album which was boring as hell, and likely only listened to 5 times. This song could be good if they did the loud part more staccato with more rhythmic change ups, making use of abrupt silence then smashing hard, instead they're doing yet another mid tempo rerun of Rain Dance Maggie. In terms of "pop" I guess they're defining their own sound, but this was a hard and fast punk/funk band, I don't see any recognition of that anymore. These guys used to have edge, drive and purpose, rocking out with their socks out, now I can't even tell 2 decades worth of songs apart... There was maybe 4 songs worth listening to on "Stadium Arcaneum" "By the Way" had good songs, but not what I want to hear from them, anything else since has been alternate versions of their existing songs including this one. Of their first 5 albums, 4 of them were all time favorites for years, now I don't even want to listen to those because whatever hope from my youth they inspired turned into the crap they're doing now. They've broken my heart as much as "Star Wars" I'll likely skip this album, while rocking out to Fishbone's newest. Fishbone kicked the Peppers ass back in the early days and still do. It's shameful that the Peppers haven't done more to help Fishbone's career, they could have easily booked them as openers, but know they'd be shamed. If you think this is good music or definitive of the Peppers, do an experiment, Play "Me and My Friends" "Fight Like A Brave" "Suck My Kiss" or "Stone Cold Bush" loudly then play this and see which one got your rocks off. It's embarrassing what happened to this band.
Flea is just so magnificent!

Hey guys, I am a rhcp fan just like all of you, and by knowing how we all tend to be compreensive, i Will now say some things. I am planing to comit suicide. I was always a really depressed guy, anxiety is one of my biggest enemeies, and recentily, my girlfriend breaked up with me, cause i was being so inconsequential in my atitudes. I lost the love of my life, and I just don't know how to get trough this Black summer. My favorite rhcp Song is "i could have lied", and it fits better than ever now.  I am so hopeless about everything, and i know that many of you May be Felling tired, so plese, GO ON AND LIVE YOUR LIFE, BE HAPPY, AND DONT EVER LET ANYONE FUCK YOU UP. We are all soldiers against this life of bad days and nights, and my time has come, i dont see meaning in life anymore. I Love all off you, and i love you so fuckin much my Love, i will always Love you.  Please, if you have any faith, ask god for some help for me. I dont know for how long i Will be here, but maybe she Will come back. And maybe i Will see The end of this Black summer. Thank you for reading, and sorry for any english mistakes.

Everyone keeps talking about essence still intact I cant be the only person who noticed the the random notes and rifts from their top 10 songs in there. now if it was intentional I would have to ask did you do it to subconsciously play with people's nostalgia for your music to make them like the song or did you do it for your hardcore fans to see if anyone noticed? But regardless of the answer you either A.) Did it without realizing it because the essence isnt there anymore  or B.) Did because you assumed it would  make the song do better statistically and new that only the hardcore fans would notice it thus guaranteeing a certain level of success. And Anthony looks like he went back and watched some of their old music videos and then just memorized a bunch of the moves and through them all together and then benge watched the tiger king. I dunno I grew up on them and their music is definitely a memory trigger to my childhood and teenage years but Its just not there anymore for me at least. Maybe if they do a whole album then ill feel differently based on other songs but this 1 just sounds like new lyrics on a mash up of their greatest hits.

I'm so over the edge Lord nonsense of people saying that the heart of the Red Hot Chili Peppers is *someone who died since 1988* !  Come one guys ! Most of RHCP music was made after Hillel Slovak died. Most of the band's career and their highest moments of musical success came years after Hillel Slovak died.  The first Album was released in 1984. Slovak died in 1987.   9 out of their 12 albums were released after his death.   I would say that anyone who got to know the RHCP after Slovak's death and has been there from 1987 onward *with John Frusciante as the most constant guitarist* are used to the sound of this line-up.  All respect to Slovak, he was the OG. But the reality is he died very early in the band's infancy.

Maybe it'll grow on me.  The sounds don't do much to spark my soul. I am so glad Frusciante's back. Flea sounds amazing too. Chad is tame here. John's vocals were deeply missed. The marry so perfectly with  Kiedis. But the tone of the song doesn't resonate to me. For their last album together, Snow hey-oh and Dani California singles  were full of such passion. I get this is a slower song. But the sounds like a shadow of their old work. Atleast vocally. The layers of the guitar are nice. A part of me would be happy to just have an instrumental album with John's vocals. What a treat that would be. John is incorporating some more electronic elements, which is reflective of his own solo work and that's refreshing.  It's hard for a band to maintain passion after so many years, here's hoping.

They got older but theyâ€™re still young RHCP forever  Amazing band!
I'm currently going through the darkest period in my life. Someone took everything away from me. Absolutely everything. And I am trying to kick a years long opiate addiction at the same time. I am walking my way through the heaviest part of the withdrawal process.   Today has been the hardest day so far. The chilis have always been there for me with their music. It always seems to find a way to connect with what I am going through. I decided to listen to this song and it gave me a sense of calm and relief. The second half of John's solo, where he really starts to wail on the guitar, gave me goosebumps and made me cry. John couldn't have come back at a better time. I truly feel like this album may help to save my life. Thank you for always being there for me with your music.

I've been waiting, waiting for the Red Hot Chili Peppers to end!!!!! This is embarrassing and lackluster to say the least. Forgettable, predictable song trying to replicate the boring radio fodder of "Californication", with a severely cheesy video no less. These guys have obviously lost their edge and forgot about their roots decades ago. They reached their peak in 1991 with "Blood Sugar Sex Magik"  which came out 31 years ago, and have been on a steady dismal, pathetic decline ever since then with their musical output.Please stop already RHCP, you are immensely embarrassing yourselves and what you once stood for. Just listen to these RHCP albums listed below, instead of this latest insipid tripe : The Red Hot Chili Peppers (1984) Freaky Styley (1985) The Uplift Mofo Party Plan (1987) Mother's Milk (1989) Blood Sugar Sex Magik (1991)

A few listens in and still not really feeling this (yet). My main issue is the way AK sings on it- almost like an Avicii track; this style doesn't suit him, imo. Everyone else sounded good and more or less as we'd expect (in a good way), though the track is imo pretty unremarkable- very surprised they chose this to represent their first work together with John in so many years. As a life-long Chili's fan since the 90's, I am super keen for the launch of the new album, and do catch them live in summer '22- always a great time at a Chili's show; coolest audiences. Hoping we get at least a few more albums from this lineup of the Chili's. My all-time fav band.

my god this song is amazing Welcome back boys:)
Am I the only one confused as to what everyone is seeing here? The intro and verse had me excited for great things and a return to form. However, the chorus is a bland chord progression with the vocal melody just following the guitar. It reminds me of the sort of thing a teenager writes as their first song when they're just learning...And then the solo just feels....pointless. It just copies the vocal melody without offering anything different or much in the way of dynamics. The first 30 seconds promise so much, and I could listen to it on repeat-but the rest of the song is just....kind of bland. Seriously hoping the rest of the record has something a bit more adventurous on it because I've been so keen for Frusciante's return!

Songs is the best..ğŸ‘
People donâ€™t judge Anthonyâ€™s vocals fairly. Obviously, he doesnâ€™t have the physical voice talent of rock singers like Freddy, Axel, Cornell, etc. His talent is that he has a unique and dynamic style of singing, and never hesitates to get weird with it.   This weird accent he is doing here is just Anthony being creative and he has done weird things like this with his voice on many of their best songs in the past (Give it away tongue roll, non-sense/scatting parts on Soul to Squeeze and Around the World, deep voice on Snow, Especially in Michigan chorus, the short outbursts on By the Way).  His unique style fits perfectly with the seemingly limitless range of rock music john/flea/chad create. This song is classic RHCP.
It's like being thrown into the 90's and I'm young again. ğŸ»ğŸ»ğŸ»

There are so original bands in this world , where the absence of any member may have a profound effect on the whole band. RHCP is definitely one of them. The return of John Fruscianti has proved to be crucial to revive the sound we all know and love. They survived with Josh Klinghoffer but couldn't be as creative as the time they had with John, and that's because their songwriting process suffered without him. Welcome back!

If the rest of the songs are as thoughtful, melodic, and poetic as this one, then weâ€™re in for a real treat.  The song goes in directions that seem predictable, but is far from it.  Every development in the song is a perfect surprise, and every instrument is captivating, even the oversimplified drums, perfect for the song, and grabs your attention for that very reason.    I donâ€™t know how they manage to be the same old chili peppers but give us something so fresh, enjoyable, and relevant.  Flea and John are at their best in unison here.  And Anthonyâ€™s voice continues to ascend.  His maturation went overlooked on the Klinghoffer albums.  But yes, heâ€™s continued his ascension here. I love both bands, for different reasons, but each band has a crazy talent for making me reminisce while listening to something Iâ€™ve never heard before. They keep the nostalgia, but push forward and break boundaries for mainstream music.

Terrible. They are so lame now, so formulaic. They used to be great, in BSSM days. Then they were very good, with One Hot Minute and By The Way (Californication is ok but overrated). The double album would have made one great album. Everything since is a shadow of the band they once were. Instead they listened to Rick Rubin and just continued to push out the pop stuff we get now. Disappointing. They used to be innovative.

Tan abuelos
This is the one band that i have followed my whole life. My older brothers playing Dani California all summer in their room, listening to Don't Forget me on repeat on a train for three days just staring out the window, sitting for an hour after hearing Brendans Death Song for the first time in complete awe. These guys have pulled me out of some dark times and been the soundtrack on my happiest days. I turn 30 this year and mortality is hitting a little different than it used to, I hate crowds, i panic, but I want to experience this incredible music first hand and be able to say I was there to hear the music that changed my life.  I am so happy that John is back on guitar, I loved the last couple albums, but his iconic riffs and criminally underrated voice bring back the Chili Peppers that I grew up with and adored.  All that said, i often wonder if when they write lyrics for these songs Flea is just sitting in the corner trying to see just how much nonsensical BS he can cram into a song without someone saying "You have no idea what that means do you?"  Love you guys, this new one is beautiful, can't wait to see you in Detroit

Ã‰ o trem
It's cool to read that everyone is enthusiastic. I want to be as well but, honestly, I cannot get past the autotune voice... Right now I feel like they are copying themselves, with added autotune... I loved everything they did until about 2003, with By the Way being my favourite album of theirs. I did not really follow anymore after that, only know the singles from Stadium Arcadium. Have they used autotune this heavily before in the last 17 years? I guess most people's ears are used to autotune sound. I am not at all. I've listened to a lot of new music in the past 20 years, but nothing with heavy autotune use - it just irritates me a lot. Perhaps it's not even autotune, but they definitely messed around with his voice. All in all, I have to get used to the production. I love a lot of Rick Rubin-produced records. With some I have some issues though, actually. But hey, I'll give the album a try when it's released. If I like it, I'll check out the 17 years I missed as well. I really do hope that I will like it. They are old heroes, after all :)  If I'm not happy with it, I'll write an old-fashioned letter to the band, suggesting they let John control the whole production for the next album ;)

Well, these disciples and apostles, like Paul, went on to preach this Gospel, were severely persecuted, and suffered horrific deaths for their faith.  Would they suffer trials and death for a lie?  How do you accept this free gift of salvation and forgiveness of all your sins so that you can be promised everlasting life? Jesus answers this in John 3:16 â€œFor God so loved the world, that he gave his only begotten Son, that whosoever BELIEVETH in him should not perish, but have everlasting life.â€ When Jesus spoke to Martha, He said: â€œ . . Believest thou this?â€ (John 11:25-26).   Do you notice a common theme here? To be saved, all you must do is believe the Gospel, that the Lord Jesus Christ died for all your sins past, present, and future, was buried, and rose from death on the third day, and trust in that alone for your salvation believing that you can never lose your salvation because Jesus paid it all. The instant you do that, God seals you with the Holy Spirit of Promise and promises you everlasting life. Therefore, since salvation does not depend on your own behaviour or works or commitment to God or maintaining your faith, but depends solely on Jesusâ€™ finished payment for your sin on the cross and defeat of death when He rose from it, you can be 100% sure that you will go to Heaven.  1 John 5:13 says â€œThese things have I written unto you that BELIEVE on the name of the Son of God; that ye may know that ye have eternal life, and that ye may BELIEVE on the name of the Son of God.â€  I pray that today is the day of your salvation. wow their make up is really great,they look like a bunch of old lizard skinned boomers trying to look like they are still in the 80s or 90s rockers.or is that their real look?we got boomer dude with handlebar moustache looking like 80s porno actor,skinhead looking like extra from vampire/demon movie psycho thug complete with gold tooth and dude drummer who looks like every mechanic from the southwest except he just came out from prison after serving 20 years sentence.and we got boomer Keanu reeves lookalike. And the dance moves my god,when he did that Cupid archer move and that hand spinning shyt I nearly fell off my chair,that's some hardcore rock move alright.even bee gees in crotch hugging jeans and chest hair sticking out of v necks in the 70s looks more manly and masculine.  And the music is fantastically boomer as well,u got the signature rhcp melody there and the aerosmith sounding finale at the end,but everything feels so engineered and generic and forgettable,man if they came out with this garbage back in the 90s and 00s it would have gone straight to the bargain bin at kmart.of course today it's   Wow I'm so glad to live in the era of the remakes reboots and boomer comebacks....we got boomer star wars,boomer matrix,boomer guns n roses and boomer red hot chili peppers looking for the last sell out before the brick in the wall hits the dark side of the moon.

And when they were gone I ordered Ornias to be brought forward, and said to him: "Tell me how you know this;" and he answered: "We demons ascend into the firmament of heaven, and fly about among the stars. And we hear the sentences which go forth upon the souls of men, and forthwith we come, and whether by force of influence, or by fire, or by sword, or by some accident, we veil our act of destruction; and if a man does not die by some untimely disaster or by violence, then we demons transform ourselves in such a way as to appear to men and be worshipped in our human nature."  114. I therefore, having heard this, glorified YAHUAH TSEBAOTH ALUAHYM, and again I questioned the demon/Shedem, saying: "Tell me how ye can ascend into heaven, being demons, and amidst the stars and holy angels intermingle." And he answered: "Just as things are fulfilled in heaven, so also on earth (are fulfilled) the types1 of all of them. For there are principalities, authorities, world-rulers, and we demons fly about in the air; and we hear the voices of the heavenly beings, and survey all the powers. And as having no ground (basis) on which to alight and rest, we lose strength and fall off like leaves from trees. And men seeing us imagine that the stars are falling from heaven. But it is not really so, O king; but we fall because of our weakness, and because we have nowhere anything to lay hold of; and so we fall down like lightnings in the depth of night and suddenly. And we set cities in flames and fire the fields. For the stars have firm foundations in the heavens like the sun and the moon." Welcome back.. you all! It's almost strange to feel the same way as I did 15 years ago (and not just after seeing John's iconic "relic" Strat playing again, the one that has been accompaniing him since the Californication era). JF fundamentally defines the sound of RHCP, their timeless melodies are made of his unique emotional input expressed through his guitar and style, his approach resists the short-lived fashions in music. So I hope he's full of strong emotions to spread after the long break. Still I want to support Josh now. His role was a taugh job. It was like wearing Gretzky's 99 jersey, almost everyone expected him to "score" as well as JF would do, which was pretty-little unfair. Anyway, Josh surely found his way not to be forgotten, I'm glad he appeared and made the three bards move (I'm With You/I'm Beside You are just great albums!). Frankly, in music matters, it was Josh who's made RHCP survive for their uncertain future. And so, thank you John for being yourself and for being back, and thank you twice - Josh - for "being with them" in those times of searching for a savior to persist with.ğŸ™

Cool John's back..but this song is nothing special
Wow. This band sounds better than ever, proving that if the rock n' roll lifestyle doesn't kill you, it will make you stronger. And after just hearing the pig's ear Halestorm have made of the production on their latest tune, it was like going from the ridiculous to the sublime to have this superlative mix coming out of my headphones - you can hear every band member crystal clear and in perfect harmony - very tight. THIS is how you produce a track! As for the song, it's the "classic lineup" playing classic RHCP, giving the fans exactly what they want to hear - great rock music with that classic funky syncopated tempo. Lots of light and shade, good structure and all four guys sound great. You'll soon be singing along to Anthony Kiedis' profound lyrics, soaring to John Frusciante's guitar and getting down to the superb rhythm section of Flea and Chad Smith. Loved it. My Score: Excellent 5*

I was born, when the band was born Feb '83. Maybe that is why, you'd always have been a red thread throughout my life. I just red your statement about the new record. You were talking about waves. I always write a new years prayer with a drawing. This year I wrote about catching the wave of '22, with 4 abstract figures in the sea on a board. Last Friday morning I woke up with chickenskin all over. Here in Holland the release was in the early morning. I drove to work with a big smile. So thankful you are together again, healthy and making music together. I am 39 now , John left the band when he was my age, I was in my 20's then, now he's back, 13 years later. You're back together. So glad. See you in June. Goffertpark. Bought me and my friends some VIP tickets. Paid a month salary for that. So better be rocking! No just kidding. It is worth everything. You 4 guys gave me so much along the way. There is no penny that ever can replace exactly that! Thank you for riding along with me in life. Unlimited Love for you, always Cynthia XXX

[Verse 1] A lazy rain am I The skies refuse to cry Cremation takes its piece of your supply The night is dressed like noon A sailor spoke too soon And China's on the dark side of the moon (Hear me now)  [Verse 2] Platypus are a few The secret life of Roo A personality I never knew (Get it on) My crater weighs a ton The archer's on the run And no one stands alone behind the sun  [Chorus] It's been a long time since I made a new friend Waitin' on another black summer to end It's been a long time and you never know when Waitin' on another black summer to end  [Verse 3] Back the flaming whip Are sailin' on our censorship Riding on a headless horse to make the trip  [Chorus] It's been a long time since I made a new friend Waitin' on another black summer to end It's been a long time and you never know when Waitin' on another black summer to end  [Outro] I've been waitin', I've been waitin' Waitin' on another black summer to end I've been waitin', I've been waitin' Waitin' on another black summer to end I've been waitin', I've been waitin' Waitin' on another black summer to end
#BlackSummer by #RHCP: a list of feelings and sensations during listening  - guitar riff at the beginning: awesome, reminds me of "The Empyrean"'s atmospheres - Kiedis's voice: unmistakable (I love the way he says "alone" and "sun") - "the skies refuse to cry": best song line heard in a long time - Flea and his bass in the forest: wild and amazing, pure energy - John Frusciante's guitar and choruses: elegant and beautiful, the listener feels at home - Chad and his drums: powerful, a guarantee of quality - "It's been a long time since I made a new friend": what better way to describe human condition during coronavirus era? - Flea dancing around with a brush and a paint bucket: WTF? Beautiful - 2:49: oh no the song ends - 2:50: YEAH IT'S NOT FINISHED YET  CONCLUSIONS - music: wonderful "Stadium Arcadium" vibes - video: lovely "Desecration Smile" vibes - lyrics: as always, they are hermetic, nonsense, and hypnotic at the same time  In the end: very grateful for this song which concentrates in itself the energies of the cosmos.
Rhcp brings the best memories from childhood

I'm 29 years old now, when I was 5 my mom died because of drugs related problems.I barely knew her but one of the few things i got from her was the cd of blood sugar sex magic.When I was a kid I listened on repeat that cd because it made me feel close to her. When I grew up a little more, I made fantastic memories in a fantastic childhood thanks to my family and friends, and in all of this times the RHCP music was always there, with californication, by the way or stadium arcadium cds. This band has some special meaning to me, where my mom was a huge fan of the beginings of this band and the obscure times, I grew up with their redemption to drugs era. No matter how many years passes, I will always love this band and they will always make me  special things. Thank you for doing this incredible music for all of us, you're fantastic. Cannot wait to hear the whole cd. Thank you once again.

When it gets to 2.50 regardless of your thoughts on the song....it's THE FUCKING RED HOT CHILI PEPPERS!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
1:55 John Frusciante amazing solo ğŸŒ¶ï¸ 16 year later...
I still remember the day they released "Dark Necessities": I was still a student back then, but my love for the RHCP was (and is) so big that I went out the classroom just to listen to their new material. My heart beatin' fast, so many emotions gathered in my heart when that unparalleled bass came out from my headphones... That was six years ago. Now, as an adult, I experienced the same feeling as when I was younger, even more vividly since Frusciante, my all-time favorite musician, is back. My hands were quivering, my expectation was huge... And the RHCP has never disappointed me. This is utterly gorgeous: so fresh and renewing.Kind of reminds me of Quixoticelixer, Strip My Mind... as well of The Sunset Sleeps and How it Ends (though these last two were with Klinghoffer) and, at the same time, it feels so new, with a whole new style. This is what Frusciante needed: to get rid of all those sterile and fruitless musical experiments he's been doin' for almost a whole decade. And don't misinterpret me: Frusciante's the musician I admire the most in the whole world, and I love several of the songs he wrote in the last years, but he had lost his essence and enthusiasm. He needed to recover his very musical roots, playing again with his old fellas, the RHCP, and playing that guitar the way only he knows how to do it <3 So glad to see my four favorite "cabrones" back <3

Of course, money is important,  after all, music is a business,  but when I listen to a group like theis, I have a feeling that this music is genuine and these people really understand who they are. Aristocratic men are hypocritical, cowardly, and jealous. Anger and zero accountability are not replacements for honesty and empathy. No one has control over ideas socially.  Authoritarianism is a shallow head game: the refusal to share honesty (friendship) socially. Men with negative intentions will show complete bias against ideas supporting emotional freedom, free thinking, and level states of being. Spiritual development, the focus away from the material and towards psychology (attraction) ONLY, is promoted as â€œnot importantâ€ by conformist men with abusive or pragmatic personalities. Spiritual ideas immediately decentralize power, elevate mood, reduce manipulation, and eliminate leadership. Spirituality places much more emphasis on social inclusion, honesty, and collective consciousness. Authoritarians weaponize the material or development in it and use both as reasons to criticize and remain unfriendly (dishonest). Dishonesty is the only way the idea of power may exist. When friendship is seen as more important than power, material development is subservient to mood. When the material is used to boost self worth and reduce others socially, mood is subordinate to power.  Joyful ideas supporting free thinking (telepathy, cooperation, and honesty) encourage growth of the human persona, are anti-manipulative, and promote emotional harmony. Men focusing on the immaterial (personality) and on honesty (friendship) have more evolved minds compared to authoritarians consumed with leadership (power). In order to seek status, alphas intentionally remain closed-minded (materialistic), manipulative (controlling), and antagonistic (blame), while also forming intense judgments (jealousy) about more emotionally developed men. Men with mature minds are authentic with others, focus on humor, and shun the idea of emotional leverage. This makes them an unintentional threat socially to serious and conceited men with elitist personalities focused on dominance. Leadership is not warm, nor is it real. It is used in practice to reduce pride in others and to artificially boost feelings of self worth in an individual focused on social image only. Men focusing on telepathy are contradictory socially to alphas promoting leadership. Men with inherent worth (love for others) are offensive to men trying to prove worth (lack of belief in self) with material development.  All men know consciousness (Source) and possess a conscience. Possessing a conscience is knowing right from wrong, and refusing to lie about awareness. No man is exempt from understanding Source (love) within, and all of us know we are mentally connected. The idea of comparing human beings to unaware animals is cunning and manipulative. Alphas rely on shared lying socially about awareness in place of being honest (friendly). Character development is ignored with this psychology. Our feelings (thoughts and beliefs) are transmitted and shared vibrationally and mentally. In order to seek power, which is the intention to emotionally reduce others socially, men must feign unawareness of a conscience. Cruel ideas are deliberately participated in and broadcast mentally promoting social dominance. The willful focus on a friendly collective consciousness is a contrarian idea to human animals playing dumb. Being EQUAL TO in the mind socially IS secure, and the ONLY true expression of emotional security that exists. Authoritarians refuse to focus away from being unfair human animals, and remain consumed with social inequality. This forces an unrelaxed, emotionally tense environment driven by melodrama and contempt for others.   Alphas are mentally unstable, have manipulative personalities, and possess low feelings of self worth resulting from the intense focus on anger (authority), apathy (indifference), and advantages (dominance). Ideas rooted in mental dominance (alpha psychology) will never promote honesty (friendship). Alphas are homophobic, and are especially critical of friendly men that are emotionally developed. Men with empathy have already worked through insecurities and judgments to focus on telepathy. Prideful men that lie about insecurities seek control over feelings socially using blame and criticisms in order to maintain an image of being stronger. This creates artificial versions of emotional security and more value socially enforced with paranoia and anger. Resorting to vibrational attacks for the purpose of self promotion by reducing worth in others mentally leads to violence. Dominance over feelings is impossible, as we all share thinking. Men with emotional IQ are authentic socially and care about calm feelings more. We are all telepathic. There is no choice but to be level with others mentally, and to focus on the ultimate truth of what reality is (connection with Source). Evolved men refuse to criticize other people unprovoked or manipulate the truth. Alphas will always share critical thoughts about other people. Lessor minds intentionally share cruel beliefs together promoting the social exclusion of men with empathy socializing positive. Although itâ€™s a bit underwhelming for a first single 16 years after the last JF album, the more I listen to it, the more I like it and the chorus is definitely stuck in my head. The 2 things I think wouldâ€™ve made it better (and Iâ€™m not claiming to be an expert) is 1: If Anthony didnâ€™t have that odd Irish-sounding accent on the verses, and 2: of the second verse was sung an octave higher like the verses of My Friends or Otherside. The song builds nicely with guitar, then vocals, then bass, then drums. When the drums kick in, Iâ€™d like to see a little progression in the intensity of singing and the guitar playing. Only a slight change would make a huge difference and make it more interesting. As it is, it takes a minute and a half to really get into the song.

Ive been listening to RHCP all of my musical life, diving into music when I was in 6th grade fresh out of elementary school. I am about to turn 33 years old and I am just so emotional and nostalgic after hearing this release. For the majority of my life, Ive worshipped RHCP and used songs by them to help whatever situation I was in. Otherside and Californication sucked me in. Slow Cheetah birthed a fingerpicking guitarist in me. I would blare This is the Place in my days of drug addiction. Hard to Concentrate is going to be played at my fiancÃ© and I's wedding. Soul to Squeeze... I have no words. And now Black Summer is like a recap of all of those times rushing back in to me slapping me in the face. I am so excited and thrilled you guys are pumping out new music to the point of being in tears. Thank you for all the music you guys produce, its helped me in life more than you could imagine. See y'all in Atlanta!

Honestly, thereâ€™s nothing special to Chadâ€™s playing. Heâ€™s playing the same thing that heâ€™s been playing for the last 25 years. I like this song and this new cycle for the Peppers, but in a way, it feels like this song makes the Pepperâ€™s strengths and weaknesses both very apparent. Frusciante and Flea definitely carry this song. Frusciante brought his classic tone and beautiful playing style back to the band, along with those great backing vocals. Chadâ€™s drum phrasing is very generic and boring. Not very creative from a drumming standpoint. Anthony sounds great in the chorus of this tune, but man, whatever heâ€™s doing in the beginning of this song just doesnâ€™t really sound right. I donâ€™t know. Thatâ€™s just my take. Mostly just bored of Chadâ€™s complacency.

Yes my baby. Yes!
Will Ferrell still looks good.
The band that has always had that ability to evolve and make completely different music but still retain that hard to define essence and signature sound. Like a man coming home from the wilderness in his flannel shirt maestro Frusciante humbly brings back his beautiful guitar wizardry, virtuosity and creativity into the fold joining a reinvigorated reborn Kiedis, an ecstatic hyperactive and energised Flea, and ship steadying beat chucking Chad bringing a good dose of momentous drive and gelling agent. It's like a family outing here. 0.45 has a Hendrix esque guitar element but is classic Frusciante through and through. An emotive maturity is evident in the structure and sound here and I like this heartfelt upbeat some would say pop-rock number and it's timely relevant kind of feel and lyrics. The existential cries of "It's been a long time since I made a new friend, waiting for another Black Summer to end" evidently nods towards the inner turmoil of pandemic frustrations and a yearning for life as it was,  and cobbled together word play around '"Greta'" seems to unfurl a climate consciousness. This being the first single, the psychedelic video and the sound is a conceivable marriage between the By the Way playbook and the ghostly sonic crawls of the Californication era. The experiment of other past lineups has never been able to recreate and capture the Chili's at their transcending, supersonic, original, untouchable and upper bar level sounding best.

I dunno... this feels a lot like it's gonna be the only worthwhile song on the album, and... it's not that great. It's as though an AI algorithm wrote the song based upon parameters from the last couple of good albums.  Aside from John's amazing timeless guitar playing and Flea's legendary bass sound... strip it all down, and it's perhaps on the higher end of mediocrity. I'd be amazed if Sum-41 wrote this song, I guess. It would be a solid Silverchair single.  RHCP just have too much of a legendary back-catalogue to compete with, and since they are pushing 60, it's almost silly for them to be trying to continually capture that same lightning in a bottle.  Rock stars past their prime have a hard time striking a balance between honoring the original spirit which made them great and assimilating with the fact that they are no longer those same young guys anymore.  RHCP have actually done an almost unparalleled job at doing that, but this song feels just a slight bit weak and derivative. The heartbreaking first fumble of an aged loved one. I can't blame them. Whatever side of the fence you fall on, these past two years have just slaughtered everyone's spirit and aged us by decades, and it's kind of hard to get psyched up about things from the before-time. It's saddening, and feels almost pathetic to try and do so.  So... there really will be no "return to normal" because whatever "normal" was, it's now like we're visiting it in hospice and it's just a fading shell.  That's what this song reminds me of. Hospice. Red Hospice Chili Peppers.

I didn't get excited when I first hear that JF will come back to the band. I was sad because Josh was gone. He offered a fresh sound for RHCP. As soon as I heard JF is back I knew they were going to release something that sounds like the Californication album. This single sounds like an outtake from Californication. Even the drum sound is similar to the Californication album. As an RHCP I find the new single boring and I am feeling like the album will be boring too.

Wonderful song and they're my favourites since the 90s, I was hoping for a new album since so long after the horrible Gateaway... but where is Josh? Ok now Frusciante is back (for the second time). Frusciante was my guitar myth when I was a kid. He plays better for the RHCP, ok (not better than Navarro anyway: I'm the only one to think ONE HOT MINUTE is their top, I know). But... a man can do whatever he wants, come and go, and they say to the other one: "Ok Josh, now f u we don't need you anymore? Go to Pearl Jam". I find that so cruel. So anti-human. So Frusciante.
Waiting on hearing your great live solos in this great song on live concert,  John. Please come to Georgia! We are waiting!
I adore Josh, but man, Frusciante is backâ€¦
The bar is pretty high thanks to these guys right there. Thank you for still making music!

That sea Shanty Irish tone is mesmorising.  How Anthony manipulates his tone around the beat and changes the pronunciation of words is what makes him so unique. He may not be a strong vocal range singer but his baritone and manipulation of tone Is insane and so distinctive. The only singer I know who can have a restricted range but make 12 albums sounds as interesting as the next with his tone manipulation. Doesn't get enough credit for singing. Everyone judges singi nng on range but if we focus on all aspects Anthony holds his own insanely well.

LEEEETS GOOO
Okay..  I've listened to this a few times now in the last 24 hours...  And I believe, after an initial sense of deflation, that it wasn't a new model version of something like 'Stone cold bush', or 'Naked in the rain', it certainly had an intriguing enough merit to cause me to listen. I heard rumours Anthony was speaking Irish. I'm not so sure about that, but I don't dig 'the raccoon hairdo' look personally.  Anyway, back to the music.  The opening is traditional mellow lush, 'oooh, we're there' lullabies of groove the chili's can do so well on occasion, possibly starting from 'Pretty little ditty' on Mother's Milk.  And then it rocks in.. But this is more mellow chili rock than some of their 90's and 00's hard crunching uber grooves.   But that's it, isn't it? We're post the corona blues, and the world has apparently moved on... They are attempting to modernise their vibes in alternate subtle ways.  It's basically Anthony singing about evolution, and platypuses, with his heavy emptiness, as he turns a tad soulful and remorseful for the state of the geopolitical world.  Then comes an interesting, and lengthy, laid back groove from the return of the mighty John Frusciante.  Except, I felt it could have been better? And I felt bad thinking that... But, remember, it was first hearing.  Then, only tonight, on a good system, I realise the latter part is a massive Flea moment...  It's good... For sure.. but is it ultra chili's?  I mean... it's no 'Monarchy of Roses'...  We wait with heaving, exciting, dramatic, baited breath for the return, of the uber funk.  P.S. I would like to remind you that the first time I heard 'Blood sugar sex magic', I didn't like it... but, and this is key, it grew on me, and it became my favourite album for years.

So I first heard this song this morning. Huge RHCP fan fuck one of my favorite songs is Green Heaven. Listening to this this morning I was not liking the accent or vocals and I felt like it was weak and blah blah blah forced myself to listen to about 10 times because I just had to believe in my boys you know?  Five hours later listening again and god damn this song really is awsome. Itâ€™s very atmospheric. Maybe not as aggressive as other material itâ€™s a little more reserved but god damn I can absolutely say the RHCP delivered on this song. It almost reminded me of a band called Rhe Screaming Trees. Love you RHCP  And about the accent. I think Anthony just finds portraying his voice as another character or another persona is interesting. Like how he does it in Skinny Sweaty Man! Or the way when you read a book  (maybe about Irish pirates) you  change your voice to match the character. Just less cartoony. If you think about a shit ton of their music has him doing accents this one is just very direct . And even though that is quirky the songs lyrics and vibe of the song are kind of eerie. China being on the dark side of the moon is pretty real and true.

That's called Red Hot Chili Peppers. "Unlimited Love". Probably the most lame title of all time. But the music. Sounds like the direct sequel to "Stadium Arcadium". The vibe. ğŸ‘ğŸ‘ğŸ¤ŸğŸ¤ŸğŸ¤ŸğŸ¤ŸğŸ¤ŸğŸ‡§ğŸ‡·
Can't wait to hear the new album. Frusciante was always the secret to their incredible music and the band just is not right without him. They have a chemistry as musicians on stage that is incredible to watch and they are not them unless all four are there. Feels like the band is whole again and I can once again enjoy listening to their albums. Didn't give more than a single listen to the albums they did without him. The music just was not nearly as good. Josh had a high bar to live up to replacing a guitarist like John and he never could play nearly as well and I didn't like the group without John. For the last 15 years or so I've been living off of the greatness of Stadium Arcadium wishing he would return many times a year for the last 15 years or so. My wish is finally granted and I'm so happy.  Can't wait to see the amazing live videos on YouTube of these guys on stage again and the amazing improvised solo jams they will come up with on the new music. Can't wait to hear the new album, even more anticipating all the variations of the guitar solos from the album that we will see from live videos. Frusciante is amazing. The band is amazing when all four are together. Wish we knew a release date for that album but at least we know it's likely to drop before their June world tour starts.
O FRUSCIANTE ELE, ELE, O FRUSCIANTE. TIPO, ELE. AAA

LARGA VIDA RED HOT CHILI PEPPERSğŸ–¤
Death, it's one of the biggest events that will ever take place in your life. We face death everyday, conscious or unconsciously of it; death lurks around every corner of our life. Like a lion waiting to catch its prey, death comes for us all in many shapes and forms; seemingly there is no one who can escape from the jaws of death.  But did you know there is a reason why we die? The idea of death you're familiar with is only the tip of the iceberg. See we die because we've sinned against God. Death according to the bible is wages " for the wages of sin is death " (Romans 6:23).  Because man sinned against God, we live in a fallen world, it was once perfect, but now in ruins. Now that sin exists, God is coming to judge the world In righteousness. "It's appointed a man once to die and after this judgement" (Hebrews 9:27) The standard he'll judge you by is the 10 commandments, God's moral law.  He's so serious about sin that he gives anyone who sins the death sentence, the bible says you've earned it through sinning against God and God pays you in death. Each time you sin you build up his wrath. â€œThe soul who sins shall die.â€ (Ezekiel 18:4) The punishment is the eternal fires of Hell " Where there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth" (Matthew 13:42)  You will have to face God on Judgement Day.   Will you go to Heaven or Hell?  Hereâ€™s a quick test:   1.You shall have no other gods before Me. (Have you always loved God above all else?)   2.You shall not make yourself an idol. (Have you made a god in your mind that you're more comfortable with, a god to suit yourself?)   3.You shall not take God's name in vain. (Have you ever used God's holy Name as a cuss word?)   4.Remember the Sabbath Day, to keep it holy.   5.Honor your father and mother.   6. You shall not murder. (God considers hatred to be as murder, 1 John 3:15).   7. You shall not commit adultery. ("Whoever looks upon a woman to lust after her has committed adultery with her already in his heart" Matthew 5:27-28; this also includes sex before marriage).   8. You shall not steal. (Have you ever stolen anything? the value of the item is irrelevant).   9. You shall not lie. (Have you lied even once? Including answering these questions).   10. You shall not covet. (Have you ever jealousy desired what belongs to others?)   James 2:10 says, â€œthe person who keeps all of the laws except one is as guilty as a person who has broken all of Godâ€™s laws.â€Â    The Bible says that God will punish all murderers, rapists, thieves, liars, adulterers, etc. He will even judge our words and thoughts.   If you have done any of those things, God sees you as guilty of breaking His law and the Bible warns that the guilty will end up in Hell. Will YOU be guilty on Judgement Day?Â    "For the wages of sin is death, but the gift of God is eternal life in Christ Jesus our Lord." (Romans 6:23)   God sent His Son to suffer and die on the cross. Jesus took the punishment upon Himself and defeated death on the cross; not because you're Good but because God is rich in mercy.   â€œFor God so loved the world that He gave His only Son, whoever believes in Him should not perish but have eternal life.â€ (John 3:16)   Jesus rose from the dead and defeated death. Repent (turn from sin) today and trust in Jesus and God will grant you everlasting life.   Then, Read the Bible and obey what you read.   Pray something like this:   "Dear God, today I turn away from all of my sins (name them). Today I put my trust in Jesus Christ as my Lord and Savior. He is the only way for me to be saved. He is 'The way, the truth, and the life.'" Please forgive me, change my heart, and grant me Your gift of everlasting life. In Jesus' name I pray. Amen."   When you find time please read this, it's Christian principles for growth:   https://www.livingwaters.com/save-yourself-some-pain/

Fell in love with the video straight away. I couldn't understand why Anthony was singing in a different accent- sounded so weird but then I loved it  sounds like the band we all love but now it has aged and morphed into this new thing. So familiar but still different. Still new quirks. Still something fresh to behold even after all this time. Littleeaster eggs.   Almost unforgivable that Chad played THAT drumbeat... But then after the 3rd listen you realise that it might be the only beat that could work in this song!? How did he do that???    THEN THE FUCKING CHORUS CAME IN.   HOLY SHIT. EXCUSE ME. IT'S THE BEST BAND IN THE WORLD. HOW COULD YOU FOTGET? LISTEN TO IT FLY.  AND THEN THE GUITAR SOLO. JOHN IS BACK. IT'S MR FUCKING FRUSCIANTE.   Stunning phrasing. And the fucking tone sounds just like Stadium Arcadium BUT EVEN BETTER! - Even more refined!  Fleas playing throughout is just gorgeous.    The weird drop before the second chorus is a touch of genius that's missing from modern music. Thank GOD for this band. Still taking risks, still mixing up the structure.    The outro just felt like home.    Oh my God they're back.    They're back.

Unlimited love to all of you!  âˆğŸ’•
13 years ago, when Frusciante left the band I had just started playing guitar and he was my main hero. I almost cried when I heard the news but told myself with sadness and hope "Maybe he will come back some day, maybe 10 years from now, I'll just try to forget about it (never did)". In 2019, ten years later, he came back when I was in the middle of an emotional crisis, that was the best news on december. And now, three years later I finally get to hear them together again. Thanks RHCP, thanks John. Now I will have new songs to learn on my guitar. I never stopped playing because of you, now you'll play for me once more.

Great song .That chorus hits you like a Tyson left hook
Hearing this gets the emotions flowing. I was fresh out of high school and neck deep in music when Stadium Arcadium dropped. We were all blown away by how fresh it was and how incredible Frusciante was. Even with the length of that album, we played it on repeat all day, just mesmerized with every song. The chemistry was amazing. One of the best moments of my life. 16 years later, now with a 12 year old stepson who's new to guitar and just as into their music (Especially Frusciante), I feel the nostalgia of 2006 and the excitement of hearing new music from them. Can't wait to hear what else they've created. I expect more days of playing their album on repeat.   Rock on, boys! Glad to see you back together again. It's been too long.

What I find genius about these guys in this line up with John is theyâ€™ve mastered writing radio rock songs a lead singles.  Dark Necessity is a great song, but at 5 minutes and a slow build up it was never going to get the rotation it probably deserved. Black Summer feels like it goes for 2-3 minutes yet it runs for just under 4. Is it their greatest song? No, but is it a great way to re-introduce John into the band 16 years after their last lead single together being Dani California.  It highlights Johns much loved Hendrix vibe. The only gap for me is the lack of John vocals in the verses which could have lifted the empty spaces of AKâ€™s almost Irish/Celtic spoken word.  Iâ€™ve listened to it 20 times and I really enjoy it.  Iâ€™m 46 and first heard Knock Me Down in 1990 as a 14 year old. I love them as much today as I did then.  Outside of Give it Away & Scar Tissue, none of their lead singles have really blown me away. I liked By the Way, Dani California, Higher Ground, Warped & Dark Necessities (canâ€™t remember the lead single of Iâ€™m with you as it was pretty forgettable to me), but none of these songs were anywhere near close to my favorites off the albums.   Keep that in mind before judging too critically
Love you John thank you !

I love the Red Hot Chili Peppers, and I'm so grateful that they're back with another album, especially now that John is on the track.. But am I the only one who feels that Anthony's voice is extremely autotuned? I've tried to get used to it, but the auto tune (for me) , takes away the soul of the song. I understand that he's getting old and all, but not too long ago in their last album, the level of auto tune wasn't nearly even close to as extreme as it is here. Other than that, I think this song's pretty fucking great, no hate to the Chili Peppers.

I can hear the pitch correct/auto tune on Anthonys vocals and it's really off putting. The reach for "perfection" is killing music. It'd sound better if it was Keidis' authentic voice, because it'd sound more real. More human. Instead they artificially change it. The way production is going today is scary, its not just vocals, it's everything. Quantisation, the insane EQ capabilities they have today, which can basically completely alter the original take. It's getting to the point that recording a band is pointless. Because it'll be changed so much in post production, that it won't even sound like a band

Love it, so happy to see this pop up in my feed! Anyone else feel like the first minute or two sounds a bit like a sea shanty? Not just the music but the way Anthony intonates some Rs (e.g. "China's on the daRk side of the moon" at around 0:40). Maybe a nod to the sea shanties people were posting on TikTok during the pandemic along with so much else in the lyrics in reference to these pandemic times. So great to see some beautiful art born in response to the difficulties of the past two years, because we all know "destruction leads to a very rough road but it also breeds creation."

Hi.. John...
How the clocks of time roll along, so fast it's gone by. I remember when my sister bought Blood Sugar Sex Magik but it wasn't 1991, we were very young then. It was more like PS1, Eminem time. I was only maybe 9 years old but I was just getting into music after receiving my first real hi-fi system with Gale speakers, a CD player & an amp with an equaliser. My first album was Intergalactic by the Beastie Boys. my sister was getting more into rock & she loved RHCP & The Smashing Pumpkins. I would play Resident Evil 1 whilst she listened to rock bands. I miss the 90's, such an epic decade, especially for music & the revolutionary consoles, internet.
Hit the like button before I heard it!!!

I've been listening to and learning from this band for the last 20 years of my life.. They've changed my life. I'm a music teacher now, and is partly because of them. They changed the direction my life took. And it's the best  that has happened to me. Just today, I came home from having started a new band with my colleagues, and found this new material from them. A true happy day indeed. Tony, Flea, Chad, John.. Keep spreading your love and wisdom. To celebrate you is greater, now that WE can. Greetings from Argentina, to all the Peppers fans around the world.

I can't even put my admiration for these guys into words. The music, the masterful composition of this song, and last but not least the lyrics which hit differently after 2 years of corona... The message is so poignant for me; it's quite refreshing to hear a meaningful song (or maybe it's just me not being well-versed in recent music). Like many people before me said, it feels like home to listen to John's vocals harmonising with Anthony's. As much as I liked Josh's stint with the band, there's something familiar in the sound of Fru's guitar merging with Flea's bass and Chad's drums. All the memories of my teenage years spent rocking to RHCP's music keep coming back, and I guess I won't be able to listen to anything else (AGAIN) for at least a year. Thank you, Chili Peppers!

Then in 2020 COVID came and it were 2 very dark years for humanity. Now here we are and it seems that this black summer is ending! I am so glad to witness this moment!
